rStrava 0.17
  • Reference

Get followers, friends, or both-following

get_following.Rd

Get followers or friends of the athlete or both-following relative to another user

get_following(following, stoken, id = NULL, per_page = 200,
  page_id = 1, page_max = 1, All = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

following

string equal to `friends', `followers', or `both-following'
stoken

A config object created using the strava_oauth function
id

string or integer of athlete, taken from stoken if NULL
per_page

numeric for number of friends or followers to return from the request.
page_id

numeric indicating page id
page_max

numeric indicating maximum number of pages to return
All

logical for retrieving all the friends or followers when they are more than 200.
...

optional arguments to the get_pages function.

Value

Data from an API request.

Details

Requires authentication stoken using the strava_oauth function and a user-created API on the strava website. The default values will return the first page with up to 200 profiles. Use All = TRUE for retrieving all the profiles when having more than 200 friends or followers. You can pass other arguments to the get_pages function to have better control of the amount of users to download

Examples

# NOT RUN {
# create authentication token
# requires user created app name, id, and secret from Strava website
stoken <- httr::config(token = strava_oauth(app_name, app_client_id,
        app_secret, cache = TRUE))

get_following('friends', stoken)

# retrieve up to 1000 followers
get_following('followers', stoken, page_max=5)

# retrieve all the friends. Be carefull with the API rate limits
get_following('friends', stoken, All = TRUE)
# }
